name: Ibis Brive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked with travelsphere for the Dordogne, Albi & "accompanied" tour. The brochure featured our 4 night stay would be at La Truffiere in Gignac, or similar. A couple of days before our departure we received the itinary which indicated our hotel would be the Ibis in Brive. La truffiere boasted a swimming pool, Wifi in room, Lounge bar, Restauant all in a rural setting. The Ibis had a bar to seat 9, no lounge, no restaurant, Wifi in the bar area, no pool, all in a town centre setting. Our evening meals had to be taken in a restaurant a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Due to lack of facilities we had no opportunity to gather together for meetings and socialise as a group. The tour manager had been drafted in at late notice and had no first hand knowledge of the places we were to visit. We were marched to the local tourist info centre and given a map of the locations, then left to fend for ourselves and try to find the points of interest, which had been researched on the internet the night before and repeated to us by the travel manager on the coach. Travelsphere were sorry for our dissapointment but said, they only undertake to provide a similar standard of accomodation??? The only similarity was it was in France and had the same star rating!! Will not use travelsphere (Now Page and Moy) again..... Ever....
reviews.title: Travelsphere Hotel Swap "Beware"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A stop over en route to Orleans & after the disaster that was Mercure Chambery staying at one of the lower spec Brands in the Accor chain was unnerving.
reviews.title: Acceptable Overnight Accommodation

reviews.text: We were however pleasantly surprised - despite the navigation errors which meant driving round the wrong side of the river for 1/2 an hour trying to find the hotel - plenty of free parking & a short walk from the city centre the Ibis is perfectly positioned as a stopover.
reviews.title: Worst Ibis Hotel we have ever stayed in

reviews.text: A bit on the expensive side but with the Rugby side in town probably not a surprise.
reviews.title: Caution Ibis Brive

likes.disliked: — Carpark is not as stated in Ibis brochure. It is a PUBLIC car park with no security.

description: The Ibis Brive hotel is located beside the Correze river, 5 minutes walk from the town centre and its many shops and 2 km from the railway station. The region boasts impressive cultural sites including the Chateau de Turenne and the village of CollongesLa Rouge. Book one of our 56 airconditioned rooms and make use of the hotel facilities, including free public parking and a 24hr bar with a terrace area. Business guests will appreciate use of our WiFi Internet connection. Restaurants available nearby.
